reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was about our 4th stay here, we like that we can drive up to our room on the 1st floor. Room was clean and comfortable, friendly staff. Has a lounge and a very good restaurant across the parking lot. Easy exit off freeway.
reviews.title: A convenient overnight stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This motel is convenient to I-90 and the front clerk was extremely nice. The room was clean and well laid out...typical of most average rooms. Lots of families with children stay here and that created quite a bit of noise, from jumping off the beds above us to the pool area screaming. They were just enjoying themselves, but beware if you want quiet during the typical vacation months.
reviews.title: Average Motel, Convenient Location to I-90

reviews.text: The pool area was small and the area for the continental breakfast was very packed, but well stocked.
reviews.title: Nice Value
Not terrible, but not great
reviews.text: Good value hotel; Quiet and well kept. Nice pool for the kids to spend some energy. Nice restaurant next door also.

I think the options are fairly limited in this area. The hotel seemed pretty old and had that old hotel feeling to it, but not in the good way. It was mostly clean, but smelled a little. The bed was not comfortable at all and the room was small.
reviews.title: Avoid this motel if you are able to secure rate reduced from standard rack rates

reviews.text: Our family of five (kids ages 10, 9, and 6) stayed one night at the Oasis Inn on our way to the Badlands/Black Hills of South Dakota. Overall we had a nice experience. The receptionist was pleasant, the room (family suite I think) was large enough to accommodate and sleep our family (our view was a pretty pond and trees), the pool was a good temp and enjoyable after a long car ride, the hot tub was hot, and breakfast (included) provided something for everyone--cereal, milk, juice, oatmeal, waffles, apples. Also, since there's not much between Chamberlain and Wall, Al's Oasis (next door) is a good place to grab groceries/snacks. We would recommend the Oasis Inn.
reviews.title: Nice stopover in South Dakota

likes.liked: — Nice place to take a break from the long drive

reviews.text: Have stayed here several times over the past eight years during pheasant hunting season. This hotel is very basic, nothing fancy, along the lines of a Super 8. It serves our purpose fine, but would not stay here for a family vacation or general travel if I had the choice.
reviews.title: Average hotel
Consistently Good
reviews.text: Al's Oasis does have a grocery store, gift shop, small clothing store, restaurant and bar.

reviews.title: Adequate lodging
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Oasis Kelly Inn many times on our trips out west and we have never been disappointed. The rooms are always clean and comfortable and the pool and hot tub are great. The food at Al's Oasis right next door is very good as well.
Overnight stay on a road trip, this was a good location for a night's rest and a beer. The hotel is part of a grocery/restaurant/saloon property that makes everything really convenient.
reviews.title: A goodnight's sleep

reviews.text: ROOM: The rooms are large, well-maintained and clean. The free wifi worked great and I couldn't hear my neighbors. The bed was really comfortable.
reviews.title: pleasure to stay at

reviews.text: LOCATION: Plenty of parking near the hotel and also around the store/restaurant/saloon. The area is very safe. Al's is located just outside of Oacoma, but is only a short drive into town.
reviews.title: Questionable ethics

reviews.text: PROPERTY: The store attached to Al's is a regular grocery carrying anything you'd need. There's a restaurant and a saloon with hearty food. The staff were really friendly both over at the stores and within the hotel.
reviews.title: Love Al's Oasis Inn

reviews.text: PLUSES: Lots of amenities including an indoor pool.
reviews.title: Very convenient for pheasant hunting!
